suggestedTexts: {'subtitle': 'Coimbra - Guadarrama, Móstoles', 'title': 'Detached house'}
description: Singular property in Parque Coimbra Engel & Völkers exclusively presents an impressive mansion, located on a plot of 2,725 m2 and 546 m2 built. We access the house through a hall with a magnificent staircase. On this floor we find a large living room of more than 80 m2 and a cinema room area. Next to the living room there is a magnificent kitchen where the new owner can make the kitchen of his dreams. On this same floor there is a small living room and two service bedrooms with bathroom. Going up to the second floor there is a large hall with access to the 7 bedrooms. The master bedroom, en suite, of large dimensions counts with dressing room. All bedrooms are spacious and bright with unobstructed views. The basement consists of a garage for 5 cars, five rooms for storage or storage and a room built especially for a safe. The property was built with the best materials, including wood brought by ship from Brazil, which gives great value to the house. The new owner will be able to rehabilitate this house to his taste preserving the noble materials of the house. Parque Coimbra, a town belonging to the municipality of Móstoles (Madrid, Spain), is located 5 kilometers by highway from the city of Móstoles. Nestled on the southwestern boundary of the municipality, on the banks of the Guadarrama River, in the valley of the same name, it is administratively part of the Coimbra-Guadarrama Municipal District, along with a nearby residential area known as Colonia Guadarrama. Its urban distribution is mostly made up of single-family homes and large green areas. It has a large number of public services and shopping centers, including the Madrid Intu Xanadu shopping and leisure complex, which has the largest artificial and indoor snow slope in Spain; it has direct and immediate access to the A-5 freeway, a public transport network, a health center, a parish, public schools, a secondary school, and an old people's home. Parque Coimbra is one of the towns in the southwest of the Community of Madrid with the greatest demographic growth in recent years. However, this has stopped at present due to the impossibility of continuing to build, as the land surrounding Parque Coimbra is protected parkland. The area is only 20 minutes from Madrid Center. It has several parks nearby, and the Rey Juan Carlos Hospital is 9 minutes away.
